items.name: Mama's Delight Buka
items.short_description: Savor authentic Calabar cuisine in a vibrant local setting. Famous for its 'Edikang Ikong' soup and 'Afang' soup, offering a true taste of Cross River.
items.location_hint: Behind the Main Market, Goldie Street area

items.name: The Waterfront Bistro at Marina Resort
items.short_description: Enjoy a picturesque dining experience with stunning views of the Calabar River. Perfect for fresh seafood and refreshing drinks as the boats pass by.

items.name: Spice Route Cafe
items.short_description: A charming cafe known for its artisanal coffee, delicious pastries, and light international fare. A cozy spot for a quiet breakfast or afternoon pick-me-up.

items.name: Nightlife Bites on Mary Slessor Avenue
items.short_description: As dusk falls, Mary Slessor Avenue comes alive with street food vendors offering grilled fish, suya, and local snacks. A lively spot for a late-night feast.

items.name: Calabar Heritage Murals
items.short_description: Discover vibrant murals depicting Calabar's rich history and cultural heritage, adorning walls throughout the historic Duke Town area.

items.name: University of Calabar Art Walk
items.short_description: Explore the creative expressions of students and local artists on the campus walls, featuring contemporary designs and social commentary.

items.name: Efik Symbol Street Gallery
items.short_description: A collection of striking murals showcasing traditional Efik symbols and proverbs, offering a visual journey into local folklore and wisdom.

items.name: The Waterfront Graffiti Wall
items.short_description: A dynamic public art space along the riverfront where artists frequently update their colorful graffiti and stencil work. Always something new to see!

items.name: Calabar Carnival Grand Finale
items.short_description: Experience Africa's Biggest Street Party with dazzling costumes, energetic dance troupes, and a vibrant atmosphere. A truly unforgettable spectacle.

items.name: Obudu Mountain Race
items.short_description: Witness an international athletic event set against the breathtaking backdrop of the Obudu Cattle Ranch. A challenging race with spectacular views.

items.name: Cross River State Cultural Festival
items.short_description: A celebration of diverse ethnic groups within Cross River State, featuring traditional dances, music, crafts, and culinary delights.

items.name: New Yam Festival (Mma Nnam)
items.short_description: Join in the ancient agrarian festival celebrating the harvest of new yams, marked by traditional rites, communal feasting, and vibrant displays of heritage.

items.name: Old Residency Gardens & Alleyways
items.short_description: Step into a serene colonial-era retreat with lush gardens and quiet pathways, offering a glimpse into Calabar's past away from the bustling streets.

items.name: Duke Town Secret Passageways
items.short_description: Wander through narrow, winding alleys in the historic Duke Town, revealing hidden courtyards, ancient homes, and local life untouched by time.

items.name: Botanical Garden's Hidden Paths
items.short_description: Discover secluded walking trails and shaded nooks within Calabar's botanical gardens, offering a tranquil escape amidst diverse flora.

items.name: Marina Resort's Back Courtyard Art
items.short_description: Tucked away behind the main promenade of the Marina Resort, find a charming courtyard adorned with local art installations and a peaceful ambiance.

items.name: CICC Hotel Sky Pool
items.short_description: Indulge in a luxurious swim at the hotel's infinity-edge pool, offering panoramic views of the Calabar River and the city skyline. A perfect blend of relaxation and spectacle.

items.name: Monty Suites Rooftop Oasis
items.short_description: Escape to this exclusive rooftop infinity pool, offering a serene escape with stunning vistas of Calabar's green landscape and distant river.

items.name: Transcorp Hilton Calabar River View Pool
items.short_description: Relax in the elegant infinity pool overlooking the majestic Calabar River, offering a refreshing dip with a backdrop of natural beauty.
items.location_hint: Transcorp Hilton Calabar (now often CICC Hotel linked)

items.name: Tinapa Lakeside Resort Pool
items.short_description: Unwind by the infinity-style pool at Tinapa, offering tranquil views of the artificial lake and a peaceful ambiance perfect for a leisurely day.

items.name: Calabar River Bridge Overlook
items.short_description: Capture stunning panoramic views of the Calabar River, bustling port activity, and distant mangroves from this strategic elevated viewpoint.

items.name: Marina Resort Observation Deck
items.short_description: A prime spot for uninterrupted views of the Calabar River, the slave history museum, and the bustling promenade below. Great for people-watching.

items.name: Hills of Old Calabar Viewpoint
items.short_description: Ascend to one of the natural hills surrounding Old Calabar for a serene overlook of the historic district and the river winding into the distance.

items.name: Tinapa Bridge of Progress
items.short_description: A modern bridge connecting various sections of the Tinapa Free Zone, offering unique architectural lines and reflections over its tranquil waters.

items.name: Great Kwa River Sandbanks
items.short_description: Explore the expansive, pristine sandbanks that emerge along the Great Kwa River during dry season, offering a unique 'desert-like' feel within a tropical setting.
items.location_hint: Great Kwa River banks (requires boat access)

items.name: Adiabo Beach's Rolling Sands
items.short_description: Beyond the main beach area, find gently rolling sandy expanses that evoke a dune-like landscape, perfect for serene walks and photography.

items.name: Ebebe Creek Tidal Flats
items.short_description: During low tide, vast stretches of smooth, rippled sand appear along Ebebe Creek, creating a mesmerizing, almost extraterrestrial landscape for exploration.

items.name: Tinapa Lakeside Sand Stretch
items.short_description: A man-made sandy expanse at Tinapa Lakeside Resort, designed to mimic a beach, offering a unique 'desert island' feel right by the tranquil lake.

items.name: Tinapa Beach & Leisure Park
items.short_description: Enjoy the calm waters and recreational activities at this popular man-made beach. Perfect for family outings and waterfront relaxation.

items.name: Adiabo Coastal Stretch
items.short_description: Discover long stretches of pristine, natural beach at Adiabo, offering breathtaking views of the Atlantic Ocean and a peaceful escape from the city.

items.name: Esuk Mba Beach Waterfront
items.short_description: A charming local fishing beach where you can observe traditional coastal life and enjoy fresh catches straight from the sea, with views of the Calabar estuary.

items.name: Marina Resort River Walk
items.short_description: Stroll along the scenic riverfront promenade at Marina Resort, offering lovely views of the Calabar River, distant shores, and historical landmarks.

items.name: Transcorp Hilton Calabar (CICC Hotel)
items.short_description: Experience luxury and comfort at this iconic hotel, seamlessly integrated with the Calabar International Convention Centre. Offers world-class amenities and service.

items.name: Tinapa Lakeside Hotel
items.short_description: Stay in tranquility at this resort-style hotel overlooking the Tinapa Lake. Ideal for relaxation with access to the waterpark and duty-free shopping.

items.name: Monty Suites & Golf
items.short_description: A stylish hotel with an attached golf course, offering elegant accommodations and recreational facilities for both leisure and business travelers.

items.name: Axari Hotel & Suites
items.short_description: Known for its warm hospitality and a serene environment, Axari offers comfortable rooms and a charming ambiance, perfect for a peaceful stay in Calabar.

items.name: Old Residency Museum
items.short_description: Step back in time at Nigeria's oldest colonial building, now a museum showcasing the country's history, particularly during the colonial era. A vital historical site.

items.name: Calabar International Convention Centre (CICC)
items.short_description: An architectural marvel and a hub for major events, the CICC stands as a symbol of modern Calabar, with its impressive design and strategic location.

items.name: Duke Town Church
items.short_description: Nigeria's first church, founded in 1846, Duke Town Church is a historical and spiritual landmark with stunning architecture and a rich legacy.

items.name: Calabar Slave History Museum
items.short_description: A poignant and educational museum housed in a former slave trade building, offering deep insights into the Trans-Atlantic Slave Trade's impact on Calabar.
